PageTitle: peer filter-policy export (BGP-IPv6 unicast address family view)(IPv4)
FuncDef:
The peer filter-policy export command configures an ACL-based policy for filtering BGP routes to be advertised to a specified peer.
The undo peer filter-policy export command cancels this configuration. The peer filter-policy export command configures an ACL-based policy for filtering BGP routes to be advertised to a specified peer. The undo peer filter-policy export command cancels this configuration. By default, no filtering policy is configured for the routes to be advertised to peers. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv4 address of a peer.
The value is in the dotted decimal format.

Specifies the number of a basic ACL.
The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 2999.

Specifies the name of a named basic ACL6.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters starting with a letter. It cannot contain spaces.

ExtraInfo: If you do not want all routes to be advertised to a peer, you can run the peer filter-policy export command to configure an ACL-based filtering policy to filter the routes to be advertised to the peer.
